commitHistory(SpenPageDoc.HistoryUpdateInfo) - Method in class com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenPageDoc
Save the command history for undo and redo.
To execute undo and redo commands properly and to update the viewport, use this method with SpenView.
It is recommended that you call SpenView.updata() to create undo and redo data because SpenSurfaceView.updata() calls commitHistory internally.

findObjectInClosedCurve(int, PointF[]) - Method in class com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenPageDoc
Find the objects of the specified type contained in the closed curves defined by the specified points.
The points connect the curve in order.
If the curve does not intersect, this method connects the first point and the last point.
If two points overlap, one of them is ignored and the next point is connected.
Objects within object containers cannot be found.

removeLayer(int) - Method in class com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenPageDoc
Remove the specified layer.
You cannot remove all the layers.
If a current layer is removed from the page, the layer in front of the layer becomes the current layer.
For example, if the current layer is Layer 2 and it is removed, Layer 3 becomes the current layer.
0 - 1 - [2] - 3 - 4 (currnt layer is 2, removes 2 layer )
0 - 1 - [3] - 4 (current layer is 3)
If you call this method after calling the SpenView#setPageDoc(SpenPageDoc, boolean) method, this layer is drawn on SpenView after SpenSurfaceView#update().

SpenObjectLine - Class in com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document
Line object class

A SpenObjectLine represents one of straight line, elbow line and curve line.

The SpenObjectLine has the 2 magnet connection points on a begin point and an end point.
The SpenObjectLine can connect to a magnet connection point of SpenObjectShape, SpenObjectTextBox or SpenObjectImage object.
A magnet connection point of SPenObjectLine can connected to a single magnet connection point of SPenObjectShape, SpenObjectTextBox or SpenObjectImage object.

The SpenObjectLine has from 0 to 3 control points for changing the path of the line.
The number of control point of SPenObjectLine is changed according to the path of SpenObjectLine.
And the path of ObjectLine is changed according to position and rect of connected objects.

The SpenObjectLine has a rotation angle.
SpenObjectLine(int, PointF, PointF) - Constructor for class com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectLine
Creates a SpenObjectLine instance.
SpenObjectLine(int, PointF, PointF, boolean) - Constructor for class com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenObjectLine
Creates a SpenObjectLine instance.
SpenObjectLine.Properties - Class in com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document
Properties Class.
This is a utility class for making a candidate path of SpenObjectLine.
The path of SpenObjectLine depends on its connector position and connected shape.

ungroupObject(SpenObjectContainer, boolean) - Method in class com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenPageDoc
Ungroup the objects in the specified group.
This method breaks down the SpenObjectContainer in the current layer into objects and inserts the objects in the stacking order in the container.
ungroupSelectedObject(boolean) - Method in class com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenPageDoc
Ungroup the selected objects.
If the selected object list contains SpenObjectContainer, this method ungroups the SpenObjectContainer.
This method inserts the ungrouped objects at the index of the container.
The ungroup behavior is same as ungroupObject(ArrayList, boolean).
unload(SpenObjectRuntime) - Method in class com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.engine.SpenObjectRuntimeManager
Unload the specified SpenObjectRuntime instance
unloadObject() - Method in class com.samsung.android.sdk.pen.document.SpenPageDoc
Unload the objects in the page which is not being attached to view.
This method saves the objects and layers on the page in the cache directory and unloads them from memory.
The unloaded objects cannot be used any more.
When objects are unloaded, the methods for the objects trigger the loadObject method internally.
You cannot use methods that receive an unloaded object instance as their parameter.
The command history stack for the unloaded objects is cleared.
